mapper.select: select id, my_user_id, for_user_id, message, createtime, updatetime, courseid, obj1, obj2 from yikaodb.message where id = #{id}
select id, my_user_id, for_user_id, message, createtime, updatetime, courseid, obj1, obj2 from yikaodb.message limit #{offset}, #{limit}
mapper.insert: insert into yikaodb.message(my_user_id, for_user_id, message, createtime, updatetime, courseid, obj1, obj2) values (#{myUserId}, #{forUserId}, #{message}, #{createtime}, #{updatetime}, #{courseid}, #{obj1}, #{obj2})

insert into yikaodb.message(my_user_id, for_user_id, message, createtime, updatetime, courseid, obj1, obj2) values
(#{entity.myUserId}, #{entity.forUserId}, #{entity.message}, #{entity.createtime}, #{entity.updatetime}, #{entity.courseid}, #{entity.obj1}, #{entity.obj2})

insert into yikaodb.message(my_user_id, for_user_id, message, createtime, updatetime, courseid, obj1, obj2) values
(#{entity.myUserId}, #{entity.forUserId}, #{entity.message}, #{entity.createtime}, #{entity.updatetime}, #{entity.courseid}, #{entity.obj1}, #{entity.obj2})
on duplicate key update my_user_id = values(my_user_id) , for_user_id = values(for_user_id) , message = values(message) , createtime = values(createtime) , updatetime = values(updatetime) , courseid = values(courseid) , obj1 = values(obj1) , obj2 = values(obj2)
mapper.update:
update yikaodb.message
my_user_id = #{myUserId},
for_user_id = #{forUserId},
message = #{message},
createtime = #{createtime},
updatetime = #{updatetime},
courseid = #{courseid},
obj1 = #{obj1},
obj2 = #{obj2},
where id = #{id}
